  16. [@@@ocaml.warning "+a-18-40-42-48"]

  18. ‌type file = string

  20. external time_include_children: bool -> float = "caml_sys_time_include_children"
  21. ‌let cpu_time () = time_include_children true

  23. module Measure = struct
  24.   type t = {
  25.     time : float;
  26.     allocated_words : float;
  27.     top_heap_words : int;
  28.   }
  29.   let create () =
  30.     let stat = Gc.quick_stat () in
  31.     {
  32.       time = cpu_time ();
  33.       allocated_words = stat.minor_words +. stat.major_words;
  34.       top_heap_words = stat.top_heap_words;
  35.     }
  36.   let zero = { time = 0.; allocated_words = 0.; top_heap_words = 0 }
  37. end

  39. module Measure_diff = struct
  40.   let timestamp = let r = ref (-1) in fun () -> incr r; !r
  41.   type t = {
  42.     timestamp : int;
  43.     duration : float;
  44.     allocated_words : float;
  45.     top_heap_words_increase : int;
  46.   }
  47.   let zero () = {
  48.     timestamp = timestamp ();
  49.     duration = 0.;
  50.     allocated_words = 0.;
  51.     top_heap_words_increase = 0;
  52.   }
  53.   let accumulate t (m1 : Measure.t) (m2 : Measure.t) = {
  54.     timestamp = t.timestamp;
  55.     duration = t.duration +. (m2.time -. m1.time);
  56.     allocated_words =
  57.       t.allocated_words +. (m2.allocated_words -. m1.allocated_words);
  58.     top_heap_words_increase =
  59.       t.top_heap_words_increase + (m2.top_heap_words - m1.top_heap_words);
  60.   }
  61.   let of_diff m1 m2 =
  62.     accumulate (zero ()) m1 m2
  63. end

  65. ‌type hierarchy =
  66.   | E of (string, Measure_diff.t * hierarchy) Hashtbl.t
  67. [@@unboxed]

  69. ‌let create () = E (Hashtbl.create 2)
  70. ‌let hierarchy = ref (create ())
  71. ‌let initial_measure = ref None
  72. ‌let reset () = hierarchy := create (); initial_measure := None

  74. ‌let record_call ?(accumulate = false) name f =
  75.   let E prev_hierarchy = !hierarchy in
  76.   let start_measure = Measure.create () in
  77.   if !initial_measure = None then initial_measure := Some start_measure;
  78.   let this_measure_diff, this_table =
  79.     (* We allow the recording of multiple categories by the same name, for tools
  80.        like ocamldoc that use the compiler libs but don't care about profile
  81.        information, and so may record, say, "parsing" multiple times. *)
  82.     if accumulate
  83.     then
  84.       match Hashtbl.find prev_hierarchy name with
  85.       | exception Not_found -> Measure_diff.zero (), Hashtbl.create 2
  86.       | measure_diff, E table ->
  87.         Hashtbl.remove prev_hierarchy name;
  88.         measure_diff, table
  89.     else Measure_diff.zero (), Hashtbl.create 2
  90.   in
  91.   hierarchy := E this_table;
  92.   Misc.try_finally f
  93.     ~always:(fun () ->
  94.         hierarchy := E prev_hierarchy;
  95. ‌        let end_measure = Measure.create () in
  96. ‌        let measure_diff =
  97.           Measure_diff.accumulate this_measure_diff start_measure end_measure in
  98.         Hashtbl.add prev_hierarchy name (measure_diff, E this_table))

  100. ‌let record ?accumulate pass f x = record_call ?accumulate pass (fun () -> f x)

  102. type display = {
  103.   to_string : max:float -> width:int -> string;
  104.   worth_displaying : max:float -> bool;
  105. }

  107. let time_display v : display =
  108.   (* Because indentation is meaningful, and because the durations are
  109.      the first element of each row, we can't pad them with spaces. *)
  110.   let to_string_without_unit v ~width = Printf.sprintf "%0*.03f" width v in
  111. ‌  let to_string ~max:_ ~width =
  112.     to_string_without_unit v ~width:(width - 1) ^ "s" in
  113. ‌  let worth_displaying ~max:_ =
  114.     float_of_string (to_string_without_unit v ~width:0) <> 0. in
  115.   { to_string; worth_displaying }

  117. ‌let memory_word_display =
  118.   (* To make memory numbers easily comparable across rows, we choose a single
  119.      scale for an entire column. To keep the display compact and not overly
  120.      precise (no one cares about the exact number of bytes), we pick the largest
  121.      scale we can and we only show 3 digits. Avoiding showing tiny numbers also
  122.      allows us to avoid displaying passes that barely allocate compared to the
  123.      rest of the compiler.  *)
  124.   let bytes_of_words words = words *. float_of_int (Sys.word_size / 8) in
  125.   let to_string_without_unit v ~width scale =
  126.     let precision = 3 and precision_power = 1e3 in
  127.     let v_rescaled = bytes_of_words v /. scale in
  128.     let v_rounded =
  129.       floor (v_rescaled *. precision_power +. 0.5) /. precision_power in
  130.     let v_str = Printf.sprintf "%.*f" precision v_rounded in
  131.     let index_of_dot = String.index v_str '.' in
  132.     let v_str_truncated =
  133.       String.sub v_str 0
  134.         (if index_of_dot >= precision
  135.          then index_of_dot
  136.          else precision + 1)
  137.     in
  138.     Printf.sprintf "%*s" width v_str_truncated
  139.   in
  140.   let choose_memory_scale =
  141.     let units = [|"B"; "kB"; "MB"; "GB"|] in
  142.     fun words ->
  143. ‌      let bytes = bytes_of_words words in
  144. ‌      let scale = ref (Array.length units - 1) in
  145.       while !scale > 0 && bytes < 1024. ** float_of_int !scale do
  146.         decr scale
  147.       done;
  148.       1024. ** float_of_int !scale, units.(!scale)
  149.   in
  150.   fun ?previous v : display ->
  151. ‌    let to_string ~max ~width =
  152.       let scale, scale_str = choose_memory_scale max in
  153.       let width = width - String.length scale_str in
  154.       to_string_without_unit v ~width scale ^ scale_str
  155.     in
  156. ‌    let worth_displaying ~max =
  157.       let scale, _ = choose_memory_scale max in
  158.       float_of_string (to_string_without_unit v ~width:0 scale) <> 0.
  159.       && match previous with
  160.       | None -> true
  161.       | Some p ->
  162.          (* This branch is for numbers that represent absolute quantity, rather
  163.             than differences. It allows us to skip displaying the same absolute
  164.             quantity many times in a row. *)
  165.          to_string_without_unit p ~width:0 scale
  166.          <> to_string_without_unit v ~width:0 scale
  167.     in
  168.     { to_string; worth_displaying }

  170. ‌let profile_list (E table) =
  171.   let l = Hashtbl.fold (fun k d l -> (k, d) :: l) table [] in
  172.   List.sort (fun (_, (p1, _)) (_, (p2, _)) ->
  173.     compare p1.Measure_diff.timestamp p2.Measure_diff.timestamp) l

  175. let compute_other_category (E table : hierarchy) (total : Measure_diff.t) =
  176.   let r = ref total in
  177.   Hashtbl.iter (fun _pass ((p2 : Measure_diff.t), _) ->
  178. ‌    let p1 = !r in
  179.     r := {
  180.       timestamp = p1.timestamp;
  181.       duration = p1.duration -. p2.duration;
  182.       allocated_words = p1.allocated_words -. p2.allocated_words;
  183.       top_heap_words_increase =
  184.         p1.top_heap_words_increase - p2.top_heap_words_increase;
  185.     }
  186.   ) table;
  187.   !r

  189. ‌type row = R of string * (float * display) list * row list
  190. ‌type column = [ `Time | `Alloc | `Top_heap | `Abs_top_heap ]

  192. ‌let rec rows_of_hierarchy ~nesting make_row name measure_diff hierarchy env =
  193.   let rows =
  194.     rows_of_hierarchy_list
  195.       ~nesting:(nesting + 1) make_row hierarchy measure_diff env in
  196.   let values, env =
  197.     make_row env measure_diff ~toplevel_other:(nesting = 0 && name = "other") in
  198.   R (name, values, rows), env

  200. and rows_of_hierarchy_list ~nesting make_row hierarchy total env =
  201.   let list = profile_list hierarchy in
  202.   let list =
  203.     if list <> [] || nesting = 0
  204.     then list @ [ "other", (compute_other_category hierarchy total, create ()) ]
  205.     else []
  206.   in
  207.   let env = ref env in
  208.   List.map (fun (name, (measure_diff, hierarchy)) ->
  209.     let a, env' =
  210.       rows_of_hierarchy ~nesting make_row name measure_diff hierarchy !env in
  211.     env := env';
  212.     a
  213.   ) list

  215. let rows_of_hierarchy hierarchy measure_diff initial_measure columns =
  216.   (* Computing top heap size is a bit complicated: if the compiler applies a
  217.      list of passes n times (rather than applying pass1 n times, then pass2 n
  218.      times etc), we only show one row for that pass but what does "top heap
  219.      size at the end of that pass" even mean?
  220.      It seems the only sensible answer is to pretend the compiler applied pass1
  221.      n times, pass2 n times by accumulating all the heap size increases that
  222.      happened during each pass, and then compute what the heap size would have
  223.      been. So that's what we do.
  224.      There's a bit of extra complication, which is that the heap can increase in
  225.      between measurements. So the heap sizes can be a bit off until the "other"
  226.      rows account for what's missing. We special case the toplevel "other" row
  227.      so that any increases that happened before the start of the compilation is
  228.      correctly reported, as a lot of code may run before the start of the
  229.      compilation (eg functor applications). *)
  230.     let make_row prev_top_heap_words (p : Measure_diff.t) ~toplevel_other =
  231.       let top_heap_words =
  232.         prev_top_heap_words
  233.         + p.top_heap_words_increase
  234.         - if toplevel_other
  235.           then initial_measure.Measure.top_heap_words
  236.           else 0
  237.       in
  238. ‌      let make value ~f = value, f value in
  239.       List.map (function
  240.         | `Time ->
  241.           make p.duration ~f:time_display
  242.         | `Alloc ->
  243.           make p.allocated_words ~f:memory_word_display
  244.         | `Top_heap ->
  245.           make (float_of_int p.top_heap_words_increase) ~f:memory_word_display
  246.         | `Abs_top_heap ->
  247.           make (float_of_int top_heap_words)
  248.            ~f:(memory_word_display ~previous:(float_of_int prev_top_heap_words))
  249.       ) columns,
  250.       top_heap_words
  251.   in
  252.   rows_of_hierarchy_list ~nesting:0 make_row hierarchy measure_diff
  253.     initial_measure.top_heap_words

  255. ‌let max_by_column ~n_columns rows =
  256.   let a = Array.make n_columns 0. in
  257.   let rec loop (R (_, values, rows)) =
  258.     List.iteri (fun i (v, _) -> a.(i) <- Float.max a.(i) v) values;
  259.     List.iter loop rows
  260.   in
  261.   List.iter loop rows;
  262.   a

  264. ‌let width_by_column ~n_columns ~display_cell rows =
  265.   let a = Array.make n_columns 1 in
  266.   let rec loop (R (_, values, rows)) =
  267.     List.iteri (fun i cell ->
  268.       let _, str = display_cell i cell ~width:0 in
  269.       a.(i) <- Int.max a.(i) (String.length str)
  270.     ) values;
  271.     List.iter loop rows;
  272.   in
  273.   List.iter loop rows;
  274.   a

  276. ‌let display_rows ppf rows =
  277.   let n_columns =
  278.     match rows with
  279.     | [] -> 0
  280.     | R (_, values, _) :: _ -> List.length values
  281.   in
  282.   let maxs = max_by_column ~n_columns rows in
  283.   let display_cell i (_, c) ~width =
  284.     let display_cell = c.worth_displaying ~max:maxs.(i) in
  285.     display_cell, if display_cell
  286.                   then c.to_string ~max:maxs.(i) ~width
  287.                   else String.make width '-'
  288.   in
  289. ‌  let widths = width_by_column ~n_columns ~display_cell rows in
  290. ‌  let rec loop (R (name, values, rows)) ~indentation =
  291.     let worth_displaying, cell_strings =
  292.       values
  293.       |> List.mapi (fun i cell -> display_cell i cell ~width:widths.(i))
  294.       |> List.split
  295.     in
  296.     if List.exists (fun b -> b) worth_displaying then
  297.       Format.fprintf ppf "%s%s %s@\n"
  298.         indentation (String.concat " " cell_strings) name;
  299.     List.iter (loop ~indentation:("  " ^ indentation)) rows;
  300.   in
  301.   List.iter (loop ~indentation:"") rows

  303. ‌let print ppf columns =
  304.   match columns with
  305.   | [] -> ()
  306.   | _ :: _ ->
  307.      let initial_measure =
  308.        match !initial_measure with
  309.        | Some v -> v
  310.        | None -> Measure.zero
  311.      in
  312.      let total = Measure_diff.of_diff Measure.zero (Measure.create ()) in
  313.      display_rows ppf
  314.        (rows_of_hierarchy !hierarchy total initial_measure columns)

  316. ‌let column_mapping = [

  321. ]

  323. ‌let column_names = List.map fst column_mapping

  325. ‌let options_doc =

  327.     " Print performance information for each pass\

  329.     (String.concat " " column_names)

  331. ‌let all_columns = List.map snd column_mapping
